abstract: Republicans talk of tax reform only when they can't get their way with straightforward tax cuts, an economist writes.
snippet: Republicans talk of tax reform only when they can't get their way with straightforward tax cuts, an economist writes.
lead_paragraph: Bruce Bartlett held senior policy roles in the Reagan and George H.W. Bush administrations and served on the staffs of Representatives Jack Kemp and Ron Paul. He is the author of the forthcoming book "The Benefit and the Burden."

headline.main: The Republican Idea of Tax Reform
